thread.title: Antonio Conte warns Chelsea that "wounded animal" Liverpool will be up for the fight at Anfield
thread.title_full: Antonio Conte warns Chelsea that "wounded animal" Liverpool will be up for the fight at Anfield

author: Jacob Murtagh
title: Antonio Conte warns Chelsea that "wounded animal" Liverpool will be up for the fight at Anfield
text:
Sport Antonio Conte warns Chelsea that "wounded animal" Liverpool will be up for the fight at Anfield Conte's Premier League leaders head to Merseyside on Tuesday night, facing a Reds side who have lost their last three home matches Share Conte warns his side Liverpool will be dangerous opposition (Photo: Getty) Share Get Chelsea FC   Thank you for subscribing! Could   
Antonio Conte has warned Chelsea face a “wounded animal” when they head to Anfield on Tuesday night. 
Liverpool have suffered three home defeats in a week that has seen them dumped out of the EFL and FA Cups and left them lagging behind in the title race. 
Chelsea cruised into the last 16 despite making nine changes to the starting XI for Saturday’s west London derby win against Brentford. 
The Blues also have an eight–point cushion at the top of the Premier League but Conte insists the Reds are “dangerous” opponents as Jurgen Klopp demands a response from his struggling side. The Blues made light work of Brentford (Photo: REUTERS) But Conte knows Liverpool will be anything but easy (Photo: Action Images via Reuters) Read More Asmir Begovic confirms exit desire as he admits: I'm wasted on the bench 
He said: “Yes, [Liverpool are like a wounded animal]. Their focus will be very high. We’ll have great difficulty because when you arrive after three defeats you are very angry and we must know this. 
“I’m sure that Liverpool is one of the teams that can fight to the end to win the title. They have a good coach, really good players. 
“The crowd pushes them a lot and we must pay attention to this atmosphere because it will help them, but we have to play our football.” Klopp's Reds have lost three in a row at home (Photo: Liverpool Echo) Conte and Fabregas embrace at full-time (Photo: 2017 Getty Images) Read More Liverpool 1-2 Wolves: Jurgen Klopp in crisis after second cup exit this week 
Conte insists his Chelsea team have made massive progress since their home defeat against the Reds earlier in the season. 
The Blues have lost just once in their last 15 games, while Klopp’s men have endured a disastrous start to 2017. 
Conte added: “After four months a lot of things are changed. We are growing and improving a lot. We have a good confidence. I think that it will be more difficult for Liverpool.” 
Klopp paid the price for fielding a weakened side as Liverpool lost to Wolves at the weekend, but the Italian showed Chelsea have plenty in reserve after his second-string thumped Brentford. 
Goals from Willian, Pedro, the departing Branislav Ivanovic and Michy Batshuayi sealed their spot in the fifth round. Hogan made his return for the Bees in west London (Photo: getwestLondon) 
Brentford’s top scorer Scott Hogan returned to the fray as a second-half substitute but boss Dean Smith admits the West Ham target could still leave in the next 48 hours if someone stumps up the £15million asking price. 
“If Scott does go I’ll shake his hand because I can understand him harbouring ambitions of playing in the Premier League,” he said.
